headline.main: BRITISH MUST HOLD CORRIDOR IN EGYPT; A Retreat of More Than 25 Miles to East Would Mean That Foe Could Fan Out AXIS STRONGER IN TANKS Believed to Have Superiority of 4 to 3, With the Italians Manning One-Third

lead_paragraph: To resist successfully the onslaught of the German and Italian troops under General Field Marshal Erwin Rommel the British Eighth Army cannot afford to retreat eastward more than twenty-five miles. Within that distance from E1 Alamein is the Amaria position, north of the tip of the Qattara Depression
abstract: Pertinax on importance of Brit holding present Egyptian lines and Axis tank superiority

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: MEDITERRANEAN, AFRICAN, BALKAN AND NEAR EAST FRONT
